"**The Wizard** " is a song by the British [heavy
metal](/wiki/Heavy_metal_music "Heavy metal music") band [Black
Sabbath](/wiki/Black_Sabbath "Black Sabbath"), taken from their 1970 album
_[Black Sabbath](/wiki/Black_Sabbath_\(album\) "Black Sabbath \(album\)")_. It
is the second track on the record. The song was composed by all four members
of the group and was produced by [Rodger Bain](/wiki/Rodger_Bain "Rodger
Bain"). "The Wizard" was the B-side to the [title
track](/wiki/Paranoid_\(Black_Sabbath_song\) "Paranoid \(Black Sabbath
song\)") of the band's second album _[Paranoid](/wiki/Paranoid_\(album\)
"Paranoid \(album\)")_.

## Contents

  * 1 Information
  * 2 Personnel
  * 3 Covers
  * 4 References
  * 5 External links

##
Information[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Wizard_\(Black_Sabbath_song\)&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Information")]

"The Wizard" is about a wizard who uses his magic to encourage people he
encounters. In a 2005 interview with Metal Sludge, Black Sabbath bassist and
lyricist [Geezer Butler](/wiki/Geezer_Butler "Geezer Butler") said the song's
lyrics were influenced by the wizard [Gandalf](/wiki/Gandalf "Gandalf") from
_[The Lord of the Rings](/wiki/The_Lord_of_the_Rings "The Lord of the
Rings")_.[2] It was also believed to be about the band's drug dealer at the
time.[_[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation
needed")_]

##
Personnel[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Wizard_\(Black_Sabbath_song\)&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Personnel")]

  * [Ozzy Osbourne](/wiki/Ozzy_Osbourne "Ozzy Osbourne") – [vocals](/wiki/Singing "Singing"), [harmonica](/wiki/Harmonica "Harmonica")
  * [Tony Iommi](/wiki/Tony_Iommi "Tony Iommi") – [guitar](/wiki/Guitar "Guitar"), [slide guitar](/wiki/Slide_guitar "Slide guitar")[3]
  * [Geezer Butler](/wiki/Geezer_Butler "Geezer Butler") – [bass](/wiki/Bass_guitar "Bass guitar")
  * [Bill Ward](/wiki/Bill_Ward_\(musician\) "Bill Ward \(musician\)") – [drums](/wiki/Drum_kit "Drum kit")

##
Covers[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Wizard_\(Black_Sabbath_song\)&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Covers")]

The song was covered by [Bullring Brummies](/wiki/Bullring_Brummies "Bullring
Brummies") for the Black Sabbath tribute album _Nativity in Black._.[4]

The song was covered by [Zakk Wylde](/wiki/Zakk_Wylde "Zakk Wylde")'s band
[Pride and Glory](/wiki/Pride_and_Glory_\(band\) "Pride and Glory \(band\)")
on the second disc of the reissue of _[Pride and
Glory](/wiki/Pride_and_Glory_\(album\) "Pride and Glory \(album\)")_. Wylde
had also been a member of [Ozzy Osbourne](/wiki/Ozzy_Osbourne "Ozzy
Osbourne")'s solo band at the time.
